botanical_details.potentially_harmful: Harmful if ingested and may irritate skin. Wear gloves and other protective equipment when handling
botanical_details.genus: Delphinium can be annuals, biennials or perennials, with palmately lobed basal leaves and showy bowl-shaped flowers in spikes, racemes or panicles

how_to_grow.cultivation: Grow in fertile, well-drained soil in full sun. Shelter from strong winds and provide support (see staking: perennials). Divide every 2-5 years to maintain vigour
how_to_grow.propagation: Propagate by division or by basal softwood cuttings in spring
how_to_grow.pruning: Deadhead main stem after flowering to encourage side shoots to flower. Cut back to ground level in autumn
how_to_grow.pests: May be susceptible to aphids, slugs, snails, leaf miners and caterpillars, including swift moth caterpillar
how_to_grow.diseases: May be susceptible to delphinium black blotch, Powdery mildews, grey moulds, crown rot (on mature plants) and occasionally cucumber mosaic virus
